questions.question: Calculate the number of neutrons in an atom of magnesium-24 (atomic number 12).
questions.explanation: Mass number (24) - Atomic number (12) = Number of neutrons (12)

questions.question: Draw the electronic structure of a chlorine molecule (Cl₂) showing the covalent bond. (Atomic number of Cl = 17)
questions.answer: Two chlorine atoms each with 2,8,7 electrons, sharing one pair of electrons between them
questions.explanation: Each chlorine atom shares one electron to achieve a full outer shell of 8 electrons (octet rule).

questions.question: Calculate the relative formula mass of calcium hydroxide (Ca(OH)₂). (Ar: Ca=40, O=16, H=1)
Write a balanced equation for the reaction between zinc and hydrochloric acid.
questions.explanation: Zinc reacts with hydrochloric acid to form zinc chloride and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: Draw and label an energy level diagram for an exothermic reaction.
questions.answer: Diagram showing: reactants energy level higher than products, arrow showing energy change, labels for reactants, products, and energy change
questions.explanation: The energy of the products is lower than the reactants, and the difference is released as heat energy to the surroundings.

questions.question: Explain how increasing the surface area of a solid reactant increases the rate of reaction.
questions.answer: Increasing surface area provides more particles exposed to collisions, leading to more frequent successful collisions between reactants, therefore increasing the rate of reaction
questions.explanation: More exposed surface area means more particles available for collision at any one time.
